newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador radio association bans president's program.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador radio association bans president's program.

text.p: Ecuador's Radio Broadcasting Association called a radio programme hosted by President Abdala Bucaram slanderous and said it would not broadcast it again, a local newspaper reported on Friday.
"The national radio and television networks exist to inform the country and not to propagate slander," said association President Louis Hanna, quoted by El Universo.
Bucaram began to broadcast "Fireside Chat" last Friday and spent much of his hour on the air attacking political opponents, whom he accused of conspiring against his six-month old government.
Hanna said the association had decided on Wednesday to ban the programme.

"In the interests of public order, the association will only record programmes which inform the country according to legal norms, because as radio broadcasters we cannot be party to slander," he said.
The government said that the next "Fireside Chat" had already been recorded and would be broadcast as planned.
